newsitem.title: SWITZERLAND: Swiss sight deposits fall to 3,165.1 million Sfr.
newsitem.headline: Swiss sight deposits fall to 3,165.1 million Sfr.

text.p: The Swiss National Bank said sight deposits fell by 651.8 million Swiss francs to 3.17 billion in the reporting period ended December 20.
Statement of December 20 in millions of Swiss francs:
Borrowing at the emergency Lombard window rose by 53.5 million francs to 53.5 million in the reporting period.
Outstanding borrowing via the discount facility and swaps of money market certificates rose by 2,213.1 million francs to 3,286.2 million.
An SNB spokesman said the drop in sight deposits was not a reflection of the SNB wanting to add less liquidity, but that the banks had enough liquidity for the time being.
"We are still meeting banks' demands. The banks have a lot of liquidity and they don't want more," the SNB spokesman said.
"There is enough money in the system," the spokesman added.
The decline contrasts with sight deposits in early December, which rose to 3.82 billion francs, in the upper end of the range.
